stores.name: PLISSÉ MIYAKE / AOYAMA
stores.description: Space design by Tokujin Yoshioka. There is a pleating machine installed to show customers how pleating is applied on a garment.

stores.name: ISSEY MIYAKE GINZA
stores.description: A store carrying multiple brands. The two-story store has a relaxed atmosphere that. The minimalist space design with a neutral white base color was created by Taku Satoh.

stores.name: ISSEY MIYAKE SHIBUYA
stores.description: The store embodies the concept of “making people’s daily life comfortable with things that have never been seen before”. The space was designed by Tokujin Yoshioka.

stores.name: PLISSÉ MIYAKE / DAYAMA
stores.description: A trapezoid-shaped concrete building with two floors and wide, designed by Naoto Fukasawa creates an impression that the clothes are floating.

stores.name: ISSEY MIYAKE MARUNOUCHI
stores.description: Japanese traditional Machiya and the spirit of making things are harmonized together in the space designed by Naoto Fukasawa.
